question: In the last century an all-round development in various fields significantly improved the ______ of life of the people.
Increased health facilities along with better living conditions had an explosive impact on the growth of ______.
The world population was around 2 billion (2000 million) in ______.
The world population rocketed to about 6 billion by ______.
The world population reached about 7.2 billion in ______.
Our population was approximately ______ million at the time of our independence.
India's population reached close to the billion mark by ______.
India's population crossed 1.2 billion in May ______.
A rapid decline in ______ rate, maternal mortality rate (MMR) and infant mortality rate (IMR) are probable reasons for population growth.
A rapid decline in death rate, ______ mortality rate (MMR) and infant mortality rate (IMR) are probable reasons for population growth.
A rapid decline in death rate, maternal mortality rate (MMR) and ______ mortality rate (IMR) are probable reasons for population growth.
An increase in number of people in ______ age is a probable reason for population growth.
Through our Reproductive Child Health (RCH) programme we could bring down the population growth rate only ______.
According to the ______ census report, the population growth rate was less than 2 per cent.
The population growth rate was less than 2 per cent, i.e., ______/1000/year.
Such an alarming growth rate could lead to scarcity of basic requirements like food, shelter and ______.
The government was forced to take up serious measures to check the population ______ rate.
The most important step to overcome the problem is to motivate ______ families by using various contraceptive methods.
Advertisements in the media show a happy couple with two children with the slogan ______.
Many young, urban, working couples have adopted a ‘______ child norm’.
Statutory raising of marriageable age of females to ______ years is one measure taken.
Statutory raising of marriageable age of males to ______ years is one measure taken.
Incentives given to couples with ______ families are measures taken to tackle population growth.
An ideal contraceptive should be user-friendly, easily available, effective and ______.
An ideal contraceptive should have no or least ______-effects.
An ideal contraceptive should not interfere with the sexual ______ of the user.
An ideal contraceptive should not interfere with the sexual drive, desire and/or the sexual ______ of the user.
A wide range of contraceptive methods are presently ______.
Contraceptive methods could be broadly grouped into Natural/Traditional, Barrier, ______, Oral contraceptives, Injectables, Implants and Surgical methods.
Contraceptive methods include Natural/Traditional, Barrier, IUDs, Oral contraceptives, ______, Implants and Surgical methods.
Contraceptive methods include Natural/Traditional, Barrier, IUDs, Oral contraceptives, Injectables, ______ and Surgical methods.
Contraceptive methods include Natural/Traditional, Barrier, IUDs, Oral contraceptives, Injectables, Implants and ______ methods.
World population in 1900 was about ______ million.
By 2000, world population increased to about ______ billion.
By 2011, world population increased to about ______ billion.
Our population reached close to a ______ mark by 2000.
Our population crossed ______ billion in May 2011.
Population growth rate according to 2011 census was less than ______ per cent.
Population growth rate according to 2011 census was ______/1000/year.
Basic requirements include food, shelter and ______.
Hum Do Hamare Do translates to 'we two, our ______'.
Marriageable age for females is ______ years.
Marriageable age for males is ______ years.
An ideal contraceptive should be ______-friendly.
An ideal contraceptive should be easily ______.
An ideal contraceptive should be effective and ______.
It should not interfere with the sexual ______ of the user.
Contraceptive methods can be Natural/Traditional, Barrier, IUDs, Oral contraceptives, Injectables, Implants, and ______ methods.
Our RCH programme helped to bring down the population growth rate only ______.
The slogan Hum Do Hamare Do promotes having ______ children.
Many young, urban, working couples have adopted a one child ______.
Incentives are given to couples with ______ families.
Contraceptive methods include Natural/Traditional, Barrier, IUDs, Oral contraceptives, Injectables, Implants and ______ methods.
The world population was around ______ billion in 1900.
India's population at independence was approximately ______ million.
Number of people in ______ age increased, contributing to population growth.
Government took serious measures to check ______ growth rate.
Motivating smaller families is an important ______.
Contraceptive should not interfere with sexual drive, desire or sexual ______.
Contraceptive methods are grouped into Natural/Traditional, ______, IUDs, Oral contraceptives, Injectables, Implants and Surgical methods.
